Mallesou wires, 12th August: " Reports from Frontier state on 10th August three trains with wounded left Askabad in direction of Merv. Bolsheviks are entrenching at foot of hills 10 miles from Askabad, fearing advance of British, also in Kahka district at Tejend, and slightly west of Merv. Morale of Bolsheviks said to be very low. Exaggerated reports of position towards Kazalinsk and Semirechia are prevalent, and Cossacks generally believed to he within a few miles of Tashkent 5th August. Bolshevik artillery were on point of escaping to Uz when plan was discovered and they were sent to Charjui. Very few Austrians now left in Askabad, one of them being artillery commander. There are frequent desertions of the Mahommedan elements."(Received 15th.)
